author: The Telegraph
title: Heston Blumenthal: summer trifle recipe
text: Discover more summer recipes » Heston’s cherry Bakewell trifle Serves 8-10 Ingredients Macerated cherries • 400g essential Waitrose Black Cherries in Light Syrup • 72g fruit sugar (fructose) • 26g raspberry vinegar Cherry jelly • 10g gelatine leaves • 1⁄2 x 70cl bottle Heston from Waitrose Cherry Bakewell Vodka • 150g raspberry vinegar Camomile custard • 150g whole milk • 300g double cream • 10g camomile flower tea leaves (from teabags) • 6g gelatine leaves • 300g Waitrose British Blacktail Free Range • egg yolks • 120g caster sugar Cherry cream • 1⁄2 x 70cl bottle Heston from Waitrose Cherry Bakewell Vodka • 450g whipping cream • 45g icing sugar Salted sugared almonds • 50g roasted almonds, quartered • 10g egg white • 90g caster sugar Sponge fingers • 150g amaretto • 15g caster sugar • 88g sponge fingers To assemble • Popping candy • Fresh lime zest • Waitrose Cooks’ Homebaking Freeze-Dried Strawberries Method 1. For the macerated cherries, strain the cherries and place in a bowl with the fruit sugar and raspberry vinegar. Cover and set aside. 2. To make the cherry jelly, soften the gelatine in tepid water. Boil the vodka in a pan over medium heat for 3 minutes. Cool slightly, then stir in the vinegar and gelatine to dissolve. 3. For the camomile custard, gently heat the milk, cream and camomile leaves until simmering. Cover and steep for 30 minutes, then strain. Weigh 300g of this mix and return it to a simmer. Soften the gelatine in tepid water. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar until light and creamy. Pour the hot milk into the egg mixture, whisk well and put back in the pan. Heat to 82C, then add softened gelatine and stir to dissolve. Sieve and place over an iced water bath to cool. 4. For the cherry cream, boil the vodka over a high heat until reduced to about 80g (100ml). Cool. Whisk the cream, icing sugar and vodka to medium peaks. Cover and refrigerate. 5. For the salted sugared almonds, coat the nuts with egg white and a pinch of salt. Dry in a preheated oven (170C/gas mark 3) for 10 minutes. Heat the sugar and 40g of water to 135C. Add the almonds, then remove the pan from the heat and whisk until the sugar crystallises. Pour on to a parchment-lined tray and allow to cool. Break into small pieces. 6. For the sponge fingers, dissolve the amaretto and sugar in a pan over medium heat. Cool. Place the sponge fingers in a deep-sided tray and pour over syrup. Leave until the liquid is absorbed. 7. To assemble, line a glass bowl with the fingers. Place the cherries on top, pour over the jelly and chill. Once set, pour the custard on top and re-chill. Pipe on the cream and sprinkle with popping candy, lime zest, freeze-dried strawberries and the almond pieces.
